{% endraw %} {% raw %}

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

This adapter is tested with the YOLOv3 Pytorch and YOLOv5 Pytorch repositories. Bounding boxes are normalized between [0,1]. Images should be in a separate folder (named e.g. images/). Annotations should be in a separate folder (named e.g. labels/) and must have the same file name as corresponding image source file with the ending .txt. Below is an example structure:

categories.txt
images/
    image1.jpg
labels/
    image1.txt

Supported annotations:

  • rectangle

The args parameter contains the following options:

  • files_path: the path to the folder containing the source files (e.g.: data/image_object_detection/my_collection/trainval/images)
  • annotations_path: The path to the multi classification CSV annotation file (e.g.: data/image_object_detection/my_collection/trainval/labels)
  • categories_file: The path to the categories file. If not explicitly set try to infer the file categories.txt from files_path (e.g.: data/image_object_detection/my_collection/categories.txt)
{% raw %}

class YOLOAdapter[source]

YOLOAdapter(args) :: AnnotationAdapter

Adapter to read and write annotations in the YOLO format. args: the arguments containing the parameters

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

YOLOAdapter.read[source]

YOLOAdapter.read()

Reads YOLO annotations from the annotations folder. return: the annotations as dictionary

YOLOAdapter.write[source]

YOLOAdapter.write(annotations)

Writes YOLO annotations to the annotations folder and copy the corresponding source files. annotations: the annotations to write

YOLOAdapter.argparse[source]

YOLOAdapter.argparse(prefix=None)

Returns the argument parser containing argument definition for command line use. prefix: a parameter prefix to set, if needed return: the argument parser
